channel.title: Updating a server without going offline?
channel.description: When my server is up, if i need to update something, i usually set the timer and when it gets to 2 cut the server off, then re-run really fast, is there a way to put the server on standby to update while also staying online?

item.title: Updating a server without going offline?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

weh ni compile and restart i stay at 100% ;D

Read full topic

item.source: Updating a server without going offline?

item.title: Updating a server without going offline?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

LeScape:

Lol, 30 minutes? --No, it is not possible. Compiling (updating) recompiles the java into bytecode (class files). When you run it, it runs the .class files, so it’s not possible to run it and change updates. Now, if you just wanted to change a menu or something, you could read from a .txt file; and I’m pretty sure changing that .txt would update the menu if it’s coded in the proper format. Just some food for thought.

Yea i new all of that, but i remembered that what you type ::update # when its done it says the server is updating wait a minute

Read full topic
item.source: Updating a server without going offline?

item.title: Updating a server without going offline?
item.dc:creator: @LeScape LeScape
item.description:
@LeScape wrote:

Lol, 30 minutes? --No, it is not possible. Compiling (updating) recompiles the java into bytecode (class files). When you run it, it runs the .class files, so it’s not possible to run it and change updates. Now, if you just wanted to change a menu or something, you could read from a .txt file; and I’m pretty sure changing that .txt would update the menu if it’s coded in the proper format. Just some food for thought.

Read full topic
